law.catch_line: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated....

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Beaded chain" means a series of small spheres, equally spaced on a cord or connected by metal shafts used to raise and lower a window covering.
"Cord loop" means a curving or doubling of a beaded chain or cord to form a closed loop.
"Draw cord" means any form of rope, strap, or string used to raise or lower a window covering.
"Internal lift cord" means a cord that is contained inside the body and rails of the blind or shade.

"Wand" means a rod used to:
rotate a vertical blind; or
tilt a horizontal blind.

text.section: This section applies only to foster homes, family child care homes, large family child care homes, and child care centers in the State.

section.section: All new and replacement window coverings installed on or after October 1, 2010, shall be cordless window coverings.

All window coverings in place before October 1, 2010, shall meet minimum safety standards established in regulations jointly adopted by the Department and the State Department of Education that include standards for:
Roman shades, roll-up shades, woven shades, and all window coverings with exposed and unsecured cords;
horizontal blinds, cellular shades, and all window coverings that have draw cords for their operation; and
vertical blinds and other window covering products with loops utilized in their operation.
If a person fails to comply with the requirements of subsection (c)(2) of this section, the appropriate agency may require replacement of existing window coverings with cordless window coverings.
